articles.author: Rob Gill
articles.summary: Tayron is a versatile seven-seater that sits between Tiguan and the lush Touareg. It's easy to say it replaces the old Tiguan Allspace, but it's more sophisticated than that and longer. The standard Tayron Life is powered by VW's bread-and-butter 1.5-litre 150hp petrol turbo with a seven-speed auto and costs £39,850.

articles.title: 2025 MG ZS Essence review
articles.author: Matt Campbell
articles.summary: The new petrol models of the MG ZS are the most affordable. The new-look cabin has a host of neat design features and it feels more upmarket than the previous model. The infotainment screen is easy to navigate through the menu system and includes embedded satellite navigation and smartphone mirroring tech. It's a shame those controls are finished in piano black material and show fingerprints very quickly.

It's similar to regular Lenses, but with a more personalized touch, built by AI. At launch, it's only available to Snapchat+ Platinum subscribers, who pay $15.99 per month for an ad-free experience.

The feature is unfinished, but it suggests a possible future where your Android phone is a monitor, keyboard and mouse away from being something like a lightweight ChromeOS machine. Google might merge Android and ChromeOS.

articles.summary: Google's Pixel 9 has a desktop mode, but it's not very well-thought-out. Samsung DeX lets you run Android apps in a windowed, desktop-style environment. Google seems to be moving towards merging Android and ChromeOS. Google announced in June 2024 that it would incorporate some of Android tech stack into ChromeOS in 2024.

articles.author: Alan Martin
articles.summary: The Amazon Kindle (2024) is the entry-level e-book reader. It costs £94.99. It has the same 300ppi screen, Audible compatibility and 16GB capacity as the Paperwhite. It's not waterproof and doesn't have a warm light, so it's more awake when reading in bed. The Paperwhite is slightly pricier.

articles.title: Months before millions of PCs will get stuck on Windows 10, Google makes its case for running ChromeOS to use Microsoft 365

The impending end of Windows 10 support will leave millions of PCs stranded. ChromeOS Flex can be installed onto existing devices.

Vasanti just launched innovative new products including Sun's Up!, a must-have mineral sunscreen that not only protects with SPF but also delivers a beautiful glow without the dreaded white cast.

articles.title: Unique launches new mini pretzel line
articles.author: Stacy Wescoe

The new sourdough recipe will initially feature an all-new flavor and crunch. Justin Spannuth, COO of Unique Snacks believes it elevates the quality of the mini pretzel.

articles.title: Beauty's Next Big Challenge To Win Over Gen Z—Revieve's Report Shows How
articles.author: Ein News
articles.summary: Gen Z is rewriting the rules of skincare. They are demanding hyper-personalization, clean beauty, and immersive experiences. They have a higher purchase and add-to-cart rate than other demographics, making them a key revenue driver for beauty brands. North American Gen Z consumers buy 3.9 products per order, 20% above the global average. In Asia-Pacific (APAC), 80% prioritize affordability and paraben-free and organic formulations.

articles.title: Meet ‘Manus': China's New AI Agent Set To Revolutionise Real-World Tasks
articles.author: Kanika Sharma
articles.summary: Manus is an autonomous AI system that can perform complex tasks with minimal human intervention. It was developed by an obscure team backed by Chinese investors. Its developers claim it can handle a wide array of practical applications, such as planning detailed travel itineraries, analyzing stock market trends, creating interactive educational content, comparing financial products, and assisting with business-to-business supplier sourcing. It has been shown to outperform OpenAI's models in benchmark tests using the GAIA standard.

articles.title: Winston invests Rs 2 cr to enter affordable luxury segment; targets Rs 180 cr revenue by FY 27
articles.author: Charu Lamba
articles.summary: Winston, a tech-driven personal care brand, has invested Rs 2 crore to enter the affordable luxury segment by launching two products in the hair styling category. The multi-styler costs Rs 18,000 and the high-speed hair dryer costs Rs 12,000. The brand has already launched an exclusive hair styling range of 6 products on Nykaa and plans to launch 5 exclusive products on Myntra.

articles.title: Morgan's new Supersport is a charming British classic to rival Porsche
articles.author: Georgina Torbet
articles.summary: Morgan Supersport is the newest model of the classic British sports car brand. It has a BMW engine, softer and more comfortable handling, and reduced drag thanks to computer-aided design. It's an attempt to position it as a meaningful alternative to a Porsche.

articles.title: Does your Roomba have things to say about the state of your gaff?
articles.author: Cailean Finn
articles.summary: In recent years, more sophisticated machines have entered our everyday life to carry out a variety of different roles in industrial, domestic and social settings. Understanding how machines perceive the world can teach us a lot about how to design and interact with them. Robots and humans have a very different way of sensing and interacting with the world. Instead of trying to make robots see and think like humans, we should focus on their ability to act in ways that humans can't.

articles.title: Amazon shoppers swap trusty Henry hoovers for 'fantastic' lightweight vacuum
articles.author: Fionnuala Boyle
articles.summary: The Ultenic U12 Vesla Cordless Vacuum Cleaner is currently available on Amazon for £140.34. With a new voucher, you can shave £15 off the price. The U12 has a powerful 45000Pa suction, four suction modes and a healthy battery life of 50 minutes. It also features a built-in green light on the floor brush and additional LED lights on the top. It is 25 per cent lighter than regular vacuums and compatible with Dyson attachments. Argos has a sale on the Henry Quick Pet Vacuum for £219.

articles.title: NTT DATA becomes a Global Managed Service Provider in the SAP PartnerEdge, Run Program Track

articles.summary: Surprise packages may represent a potential scam. FTC is sending claim forms to consumers who bought deceptively marketed antivirus software from Avast.
